IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: IPCA SUPPORTS COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS IN PROVIDING ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE AND HIGH-QUALITY PRIMARY CARE TO ALL IDAHOANS. IN 2017, IDAHO HEALTH CENTERS SERVED 183,681 PATIENTS - OR ONE IN NINE IDAHOANS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: IPCA SUPPORTS COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS IN PROVIDING ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE AND HIGH-QUALITY PRIMARY CARE TO ALL IDAHOANS THROUGH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT. IPCA KEEPS HEALTH CENTERS CURRENT ON ISSUES AND TRENDS AFFECTING THE CHANGING HEALTHCARE LANDSCAPE.
IRS990.Desc: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT - IPCA PROVIDES ASSISTANCE AND RESOURCES TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS TO SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THEIR CAPACITY TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE, HIGH-QUALITY PRIMARY CARE TO IDAHOANS. IPCA ASSESSES NATIONAL TRENDS TO ASSIST HEALTH CENTERS IN ADDRESSING EMERGENT ISSUES. IPCA PROVIDES TECHNICAL SUPPORT AND TRAINING IN QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, SUCH AS PATIENT-CENTERED MEDICAL HOME MODEL OF CARE, ORAL HEALTH AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INTEGRATION; EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS, MANAGING SPECIAL POPULATIONS AND HEALTH CENTER ADMINISTRATION (FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT AND HEALTH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY). IPCA PROVIDED TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO HEALTH CENTERS TO MEET THEIR FEDERAL PROGRAM EXPECTATIONS, ENHANCE PATIENT QUALITY OF CARE, PROVIDE CULTURALLY COMPETENT CARE, AND BECOME THE PROVIDER OF CHOICE AND EMPLOYER OF CHOICE. IPCA SUPPORTED COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS IN THEIR EFFORTS TO INCREASE IDAHOANS' ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE, HIGH-QUALITY HEALTHCARE THROUGH HEALTH CENTER GROWTH IN NEW COMMUNITIES AND/OR EXPANSION OF SERVICES OFFERED AT HEALTH CENTERS. IPCA FOSTERED COLLABORATION AND SHARING OF BEST PRACTICES AMONG COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS AND COLLABORATED WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS INVOLVED IN PUBLIC HEALTH.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HEALTH CENTER CONTROLLED NETWORK (HCCN) - IPCA WORKS WITH IDAHO'S COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES AND DECREASE COSTS BY LEADING AND FACILITATING COLLABORATION TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION AND ESTABLISH MECHANISMS TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO CARE, BY PROVIDING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ENHANCE QUALITY OF CARE, IMPROVE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AND REPORTING CAPABILITY AND ACHIEVE COST EFFICIENCIES. IPCA SUPPORTED IDAHO'S HEALTH CENTERS IN CLOSING GAPS IN CARE AND IMPROVING QUALITY MEASURES THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION AND UTILIZATION OF DATA REPORTING TOOLS AND TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN HEALTH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY. IDAHO HEALTH CENTERS CONTINUE TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR THEIR PATIENTS INCLUDING CLINICAL OUTCOMES FOR: ACCESS TO PRENATAL CARE, BLOOD PRESSURE CONTROL, CERVICAL CANCER SCREENING, CHILDHOOD IMMUNIZATIONS, COLORECTAL CANCER SCREENINGS, DIABETES CONTROL, DENTAL SEALANTS AND IMPROVEMENTS IN LOW BIRTH WEIGHT. IDAHO HEALTH CENTERS ARE LEADERS IN PATIENT-CENTERED MEDICAL HOME (PCMH) MODEL OF CARE. CURRENTLY 44 OF 60 ELIGIBLE CLINIC SITES HAVE EARNED ACCREDITATION FOR PCMH.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: YOUR HEALTH IDAHO - IPCA IS A KEY PARTNER IN THE YOUR HEALTH IDAHO PROJECT TO PROVIDE AN ONLINE MARKETPLACE WHERE IDAHO FAMILIES AND SMALL BUSINESSES CAN COMPARE AND PURCHASE HEALTH INSURANCE. THROUGH THIS COLLABORATION, IPCA HELPS EDUCATE IDAHOANS ABOUT THEIR OPTIONS FOR PURCHASING HEALTH INSURANCE. IPCA SUPPORTED IDAHO HEALTH CENTERS IN PROVIDING ENROLLMENT ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND RAISING AWARENESS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF HAVING HEALTH INSURANCE. THIS COLLABORATION RESULTED IN ONGOING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO HEALTH CENTER STAFF ON BEST PRACTICES FOR IDENTIFYING AND ENROLLING UNINSURED OR UNDERINSURED INDIVIDUALS INTO QUALIFIED HEALTH PLANS OR MEDICAID (INCLUDING THE CHILDREN'S HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM). IPCA PROVIDES MONTHLY WEBINARS WITH HEALTH CENTER STAFF AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE BEST PRACTICES AND ENGAGE IN PRESENTATIONS WITH LOCAL AND NATIONAL EXPERTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CAMBIA FOUNDATION - IPCA PARTNERS WITH THE CAMBIA FOUNDATION TO IMPROVE IDAHOAN'S ACCESS TO ORAL HEALTHCARE BY SUPPORTING THE INTEGRATION OF ORAL HEALTHCARE AND MEDICAL CARE AT COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS IN IDAHO. THIS COLLABORATION RESULTED IN THE LAUNCH OF A PILOT PROGRAM INVOLVING FOUR HEALTH CENTERS WITH DIVERSE GEOGRAPHIC PRESENCE AND PATIENT POPULATIONS. IPCA SUPPORTS THE COHORT THROUGH ONGOING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS MONTHLY MEETINGS TO SHARE BEST PRACTICES AND FACILITATE PEER LEARNING. ALL IDAHO HEALTH CENTERS ARE BENEFITING FROM THIS COLLABORATION AND LESSONS LEARNED INFORM OTHER ORAL HEALTHCARE STAKEHOLDERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SERVE AS LIASON TO STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES AND REPRESENT THE INTERESTS OF THE COMMUNITY CENTERS TO THOSE AGENCIES AND THE FEDERAL AND STATE LEGISLATURE.

UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD ON ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES ADDRESSES THE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER TAX BENEFITS CLAIMED OR EXPECTED TO BE CLAIMED ON A TAX RETURN SHOULD BE RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. UNDER THAT GUIDANCE, THE ASSOCIATION MAY RECOGNIZE THE TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. THE TAX BENEFITS RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FROM SUCH A POSITION ARE MEASURED BASED ON THE LARGEST BENEFIT THAT HAS A GREATER THAN 50 PERCENT LIKELIHOOD OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THERE WERE NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IDENTIFIED OR RECORDED AS LIABILITIES FOR FISCAL YEARS 2018 OR 2017. THE ASSOCIATION FILES FORM 990 IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION. THE ASSOCIATION IS GENERALLY NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FOR YEARS BEFORE 2014.
THE BOARD APPROVES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

GrntAsstBnftInterestedPrsnGrp.AssistancePurposeTxt: SUPPORT FOR CAMBIA GRANT, PAROLEE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND TRAINING

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS (CHCS) ASSIST WITH PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION FOR THE CAMBIA GRANT, PAROLEE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND TRAINING/TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. THE ORGANIZATION REIMBURSED THE CHCS FOR THE COSTS TO ADMINISTER THESE PROGRAMS. THE CEOS OF THE CHCS ARE MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING BODY OF THE ORGANIZATION DELEGATES BROAD AUTHORITY TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE PRESIDENT, VICE-PRESIDENT, SECRETARY/TREASURER, AND ONE AT-LARGE MEMBER OF THE BOARD. EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE DECISIONS ARE SUBJECT TO RATIFICATION BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF IDAHO PRIMARY CARE ASSOCIATION, INC. CONSIST OF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS IN IDAHO. THE ORGANIZATION HAS THREE TYPES OF MEMBERSHIP, ORGANIZATIONAL MEMBERS, ASSOCIATE MEMBERS AND SUPPORTING MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE ELECTED AT THE ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP MEETING BY A 2/3 MAJORITY VOTE OF VOTING POWER PRESENT IN QUORUM. A MAJORITY OF THE VOTING MEMBERS SHALL CONSTITUTE A QUORUM AT ANY MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, FINANCE ADMINISTRATOR, AND CEO CONDUCT A REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 AND APPROVE IT FOR FILING. A COPY OF THE FILED RETURN IS MAINTAINED AT THE ORGANIZATION'S PLACE OF BUSINESS FOR REVIEW BY MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPLIANCE OFFICER CONDUCTS AN ANNUAL REVIEW TO DETERMINE THAT CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE CURRENT AND INQUIRES IF ANY REPORTABLE EVENTS OCCURRED DURING THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO'S SALARY AND PERFORMANCE IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. CHANGES IN COMPENSATION ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FILED TAX RETURNS AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MAINTAINED AT THE ORGANIZATION'S PLACE OF BUSINESS AND ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC VIEWING DURING NORMAL OFFICE HOURS UPON REQUEST.
NO CHANGE IN THE OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

RelatedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER NETWORK OF IDAHO LLC
